=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Hidalgo (Widescreen Edition)
Review Date: 2015/07/26
Store: Viggo Mortensen  (Actor),     Omar Sharif  (Actor),     Joe Johnston  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['Product Description', "A sandstorm of epic proportions. A swarm of locusts so massive it obliterates the relentless sun. Deadly traps that defy imagination. These are just a few of the astonishing obstacles Frank T. Hopkins, the greatest long-distance racer ever, faces in the rousing action-adventure HIDALGO. Based on a true story and starring Viggo Mortensen (THE LORD OF THE RINGS Trilogy), Hopkins (Mortensen) and his mustang Hidalgo enter the ultimate extreme sport of its time -- the Ocean Of Fire. Underdogs challenging the finest Arabian horses and riders, they must not only survive the grueling race across 3,000 miles of the Arabian Desert's punishing terrain, but they must thwart the evil plots of competitors who vow victory at all costs! A great story of personal triumph, amazing special effects, and memorable characters make HIDALGO one of the most thrilling adventures ever.", 'Review', '" \x91Hidalgo\x92 is an old-fashioned saga with adventure writ large, grand vistas and a stalwart hero." --', 'USA Today/Claudia Puig', '" \x91Hidalgo\x92 is the kind of sweeping epic adventure that reminds us why we love to go to the movies!" --', 'Access Hollywood/Clay Smith', '"A rousing action-adventure which confirms Viggo Mortensen is a star." --', 'Houston Chronicle/Bruce Westerbrook', '"A welcome return to high adventure, the likes of which we haven\x92t seen in a long time." --', 'Leonard Maltin/Hot Ticket', '"Like \x91Raiders of the Lost Ark\x92 and \x91The Mummy,\x92 \x91Hidalgo\' is a rip-roaring adventure\x85" --', 'Daily Oklahoman/Brandy McDonnell']
Average Rating: 4.8

Review Text: This is my favorite all time movie, but when I tell people what my favorite movie is, I always get the named mixed up with the movie Silverado.  This movie has everything I like....beautiful horses, raging adventure," edge of your seat" moments, and it is all clean.
Review Title: This is my favorite all time movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Last of the Summer Wine: Vintage 1985
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
['"The world’s longest-running sitcom is back with more adventures from everyone’s favorite geriatrics! The year is 1985. Among many other things, Compo, Clegg and Foggy attempt to settle a question involving Nora Battys feet, an old mattress dumped in the countryside prompts Foggy to institute the Dewhirst Campaign for a Cleaner Countryside, and with the assistance of Comp & Clegg, Foggy sets out to show Digby’s donkey who\'s the boss. "']
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '4 hours and 59 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 0.8 Ounces', 'Item model number': '5957799', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '4 hours and 59 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 7, 2010', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'BBC Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Clean intelligent humor. I am so tired of during on the television to see and hear the subject matter that dominates the entertainment airwaves....sexually explicit themes, violence to the point of special effects to " shock" the already jaded mind, and other trash. The " Last of the Summer Wine" is one of the clearest funniest, most simply creative shows I have ever seen. Leave it to the English!
CLEAN intelligent comedy. Not for many.

This is Brontë country miles and miles of unspoilt moorland and a breath-taking backdrop to the antics of our ageing delinquents and their demented friends. Last of the Summer Wine has a strong ensemble cast of characters, though there has always been a central trio.', ']]>']

Foul Play
Goldie Hawn  (Actor),     Chevy Chase  (Actor),     Colin Higgins  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Comedy
['Foul Play (DVD)', 'Beware of the Dwarf, whispers the hitchhiker to the beautiful librarian (Goldie Hawn) as he dies midway through a screening of This Gun Is Mine. Suddenly, Hawn is propelled into a world of wild chases, bizarre attemp ts on her life, and deadly encounters with an as sortment of weird under world characters. Academy Award winner Hawn teams with Chevy Chase (in h is first starring motion picture assi gnment) - and with hilarious resul ts. Chase plays the handsome San Francisco detective who becomes persona lly and professionally inv olved with all the off things happening to Ha wn. Costarring a pre-Arthur Dudley Moore in one of his most delightful c omic turns.', ']]>']

Coming To America
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
['Coming To America (DVD)', 'Coming to America casts comedian Eddie Murphy as pampered African prince Akeem, who rebels against an arranged marriage and heads to America to find a new bride. Murphy\'s regal father (James Earl Jones) agrees to al low the prince 40 days to roam the U.S., sending the prince\'s faithful r etainer Semmi (Arsenio Hall) along to make sure nothing untoward happens . To avoid fortune hunters, Prince Ak eem conceals his true identity and gets a "Joe job" at a fast-food restaurant. Murphy and Hall play multip le roles, and there are in numerable celebrity cameos peppered throughou t the proceedings — including the Duke Brothers (Don Ameche and Ralph Be llamy) from Tra ding Places. Coming to America made further headlines wh en humorist Art Buchwald sued the film\'s producers for plagiarizing one of h is works. Buchwald carried the case to trial, where he won a sizeab le judgement against the film\'s producers.', ']]>']

Jesse Stone: Night Passage
Tom Selleck  (Actor),     Stephen Baldwin  (Actor),     Robert Harmon  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Product Description', 'A prequel to "Stone Cold" in the series of Jesse Stone novels by Robert B. Parker, the story picks up after Jesse Stone is fired from the Los Angeles Police Department. He becomes an unlikely candidate recruited by the town board of selectman to become police chief of Paradise, a small town on Boston\'s North Shore. The board hopes his failed experience will keep him from digging too deep into the town\'s secrets. Hungover on his first day on the job, he must investigate a domestic abuse case that ends up leaduing to a money laundering scheme perpetuated by a manager of a local bank.', 'Amazon.com', "How Tom Selleck's world-weary cop Jesse Stone became the police chief of sleepy Paradise, Mass., is revealed in this engaging prequel to the first made-for-TV Stone feature,", 'Stone Cold', "(2005). Selleck is once again well cast as the rough-around-the-edges Stone, whose drinking problem gets him ejected from the Los Angeles police force; he soon finds himself the head lawman in a small New England fishing village, where his slow dissolution continues until a routine domestic disturbance case reveals connections to money laundering and murder, with several of the town's most affluent names as possible suspects. Selleck is well-matched by veteran scene stealer Saul Rubinek, and there's good work by Polly Shannon as a city attorney who becomes Stone's romantic interest, and Stephen Baldwin as an ill-tempered local. Fans of author Robert B. Parker (on whose books the Jesse Stone films are based) and Selleck won't be disappointed by this smart thriller.", '--Paul Gaita']

['Product Description', "A sandstorm of epic proportions. A swarm of locusts so massive it obliterates the relentless sun. Deadly traps that defy imagination. These are just a few of the astonishing obstacles Frank T. Hopkins, the greatest long-distance racer ever, faces in the rousing action-adventure HIDALGO. Based on a true story and starring Viggo Mortensen (THE LORD OF THE RINGS Trilogy), Hopkins (Mortensen) and his mustang Hidalgo enter the ultimate extreme sport of its time -- the Ocean Of Fire. Underdogs challenging the finest Arabian horses and riders, they must not only survive the grueling race across 3,000 miles of the Arabian Desert's punishing terrain, but they must thwart the evil plots of competitors who vow victory at all costs! A great story of personal triumph, amazing special effects, and memorable characters make HIDALGO one of the most thrilling adventures ever.", 'Review', '" \x91Hidalgo\x92 is an old-fashioned saga with adventure writ large, grand vistas and a stalwart hero." --', 'USA Today/Claudia Puig', '" \x91Hidalgo\x92 is the kind of sweeping epic adventure that reminds us why we love to go to the movies!" --', 'Access Hollywood/Clay Smith', '"A rousing action-adventure which confirms Viggo Mortensen is a star." --', 'Houston Chronicle/Bruce Westerbrook', '"A welcome return to high adventure, the likes of which we haven\x92t seen in a long time." --', 'Leonard Maltin/Hot Ticket', '"Like \x91Raiders of the Lost Ark\x92 and \x91The Mummy,\x92 \x91Hidalgo\' is a rip-roaring adventure\x85" --', 'Daily Oklahoman/Brandy McDonnell']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Preferred Genre:** The user continues to favor comedy, with a strong appreciation for light-hearted, intelligent humor from classic British and American traditions. Recently, they have deepened their interest in action-adventure narratives that incorporate thrilling elements and strong character development.
- **Content Taste:** There is a sustained preference for clean themes and non-explicit content, maintaining a disapproval of sexual themes and excessive violence. The user values storytelling that prioritizes quality over shock value.
- **Cultural Appreciation:** An enthusiastic admirer of British humor and nostalgic narratives, the user now showcases an expanded interest in action-adventure films that feature rich storytelling and compelling journeys, alongside their previous focus on vintage American dramas.
- **Critical Approach:** The user remains a discerning observer, known for high ratings (typically 5.0) and thoughtful commentary, especially regarding films that evoke adventure and triumph while adhering to their values.
- **Format Preference:** Committed to collecting physical media, particularly DVDs and boxed sets, the user reinforces their emphasis on ownership in an age dominated by digital streaming.
- **Recent Engagement:** The user has expressed a notable interest in films that blend adventure with clean storytelling, highlighting a quest for entertainment that inspires joy and showcases epic narratives without compromising their values.

This profile reflects the user's evolving taste while maintaining a consistent approach to their entertainment selections.
